course_description: The course emphasizes structure & function of the human body & uses a systemic approach incorporating both anatomy & physiology. NRSG 202 continues with endocrine, circulatory, respiratory, immune, digestive, urinary, & reproductive systems. Labs involve dissection, study of human specimens, & basic experiments in physiology. Four hours of lecture & one three-hour laboratory per week. The course fulfills requirements for admission to nursing schools & many allied health programs. The course does not fulfill requirements for medical & dental schools or the biology major.
